entries.title: North Korea performs key test to build more threatening ICBM
entries.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un supervised the test of a “high-thrust solid-fuel motor” for a new strategic weapon, state media reported Friday.

entries.title: As regional threats rise, Japan eases defense-only strategy
entries.description: In a major break from its strictly self-defense-only postwar principle, Japan adopted a national security strategy Friday to give itself more offensive footing against threats from neighboring China and North Korea.

entries.title: A Biden admin official recently told members of Congress Ukraine has the military capability to take back Crimea
entries.description: A Biden official recently told Congress members Ukraine has the military ability to retake Crimea, but some officials worry that might push Putin to use nukes.

entries.title: At least 10 killed, including five children, in France apartment fire
entries.description: At least 10 people, including five children, were killed in a fire early Friday morning in a residential building in Vaulx-en-Velin, France, according to authorities. Four others were seriously injured in the fire, which started on the ground floor before spreading up the seven-story building, rescue authorities told local media.

entries.title: Why the World Cup may be a win for Qatar despite off-field criticism and on-field failure
entries.description: Qatar's soccer World Cup might be seen as a success in attracting tourists, business deals and international recognition, despite criticism over human rights.

entries.title: Huge aquarium that housed 1,500 tropical fish bursts in Berlin
entries.description: A huge aquarium in the center of Berlin burst Friday, causing a wave of devastation in and around the Sea Life tourist attraction, German police said Friday.

entries.title: 4 people in critical condition after crush at London concert
entries.description: Eight people have been injured, with four in critical condition, after a suspected crush during a concert in London on Thursday night.

entries.title: California woman admits to unwittingly funding foiled plot to kidnap Iran critic
entries.description: A California woman pleaded guilty on Thursday in connection with her unwitting role in a foiled plot to kidnap a prominent Iranian opposition activist living in New York City and take her back to Tehran.

entries.title: 5 children among 10 dead in France apartment fire
entries.description: At least ten people, including five children, were killed after a fire broke out overnight Friday at an apartment building near the French city of Lyon.

entries.title: Russia launches another major missile attack on Ukraine
entries.description: Ukrainian authorities reported explosions in at least three cities Friday, saying Russia has launched a major missile attack on energy facilities and

entries.title: Landslide in Malaysia leaves over a dozen dead, multiple missing
entries.description: Malaysian authorities say over a dozen people are dead and multiple others are feared buried after a landslide near a tourist campsite in Batang Kali.

entries.title: Two dead, 51 missing after landslide hits campsite in Malaysia
entries.description: Two people died and 51 others were feared buried after a landslide hit a campsite outside Kuala Lumpur early Friday, Malaysia’s fire department said.

entries.title: Daughters of Americans imprisoned in Iran appeal to Biden for action
entries.description: The daughters of two Iranian-Americans imprisoned in Iran for more than four years appealed for a face-to-face meeting with President Joe Biden.

entries.title: Is solar power the future of electric vehicles?
entries.description: A new solar-powered electric vehicle prototype can get some of its charge from the sun, reducing dependence on charging infrastructure. The German startup, with big hopes for the future, is struggling with funding though and may not be able to get its car into production. NBC News’ Kelly Cobiella takes a ride to learn more.

entries.title: New ‘Harry & Meghan’ episodes expose family fallout
entries.description: Prince Harry describes a furious row with his brother William in the Netflix docuseries “Harry & Meghan,” as well as Meghan having a miscarriage amid their legal battle with the Daily Mail. NBC News’ Keir Simmons shares more about the royal feud.
